body_html:
@petrosmol . Hello, I did add the map ops multiple times in one per epoch in my training graph. I have fixed this problem. Thank you very much. And now, I have a problem about the implemented multiclass SVM loss (see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/kernel_methods/python/losses.py), like the following picture:

In my case,
self._labels = tf.placeholder(tf.int32, [None,],name='data_labels')
Dose it mean that the labels or logits sent into the multiclass SVM loss class must be a constant tensor ?

body:
@petrosmol . Hello, I did add the map ops multiple times in one per epoch in my training graph. I have fixed this problem. Thank you very much. And now, I have a problem about the implemented multiclass SVM loss (see [https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/kernel_methods/python/losses.py](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/kernel_methods/python/losses.py)), like the following picture:
![e](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15832113/38450361-03dc76d6-3a4f-11e8-8010-780365f9e72f.png)

In my case, 
`self._labels = tf.placeholder(tf.int32, [None,],name='data_labels')`
Dose it mean that the **_labels_** or **_logits_** sent into the multiclass SVM loss class  must be a constant tensor ?
